sentences.english: The dense forest screened the guerrillas' movements.
sentences.chinese: 密林掩护了游击队员的行动。

sentences.english: Israel says it killed at least 20 guerillas in the battle.
sentences.chinese: 以色列说，以军在战斗中至少打死20名游击队员。

sentences.english: In the course of this struggle we must arm the people, i. e. , organize self-defence corps and guerrilla units.
sentences.chinese: 要从这种斗争中去武装人民，即组织自卫军和游击队。

sentences.english: Ye Lingqing confirmed the guerrillas Lin xuan Eva is rang a marksman.
sentences.chinese: 叶凌青证实了玄娃就是响林游击队的弩箭手。

sentences.english: Mr Uribe freed scores of guerrilla prisoners.
sentences.chinese: 乌里维释放了数位被捕的游击队员。

sentences.english: These carbines were in turn given to the Viet Cong.
sentences.chinese: 这些卡宾枪再被提供给南边的越共游击队。

sentences.english: The partisan disguised himself as a peddler and got by the enemy sentry box.
sentences.chinese: 游击队员扮小贩通过敌人的岗亭。

sentences.english: The guerrilla forces leaned on the river.
Back lanes are a great place for guerrilla gardening.
sentences.chinese: 后街是园艺游击队的好地方。

sentences.english: Guerrillas must move among the people as fish swim in the sea .
sentences.chinese: 游击队必须活动于人民之中，犹如鱼游于水中一样。

sentences.english: There were a lot of dead guerrillas, but we weren’t seeing them.
sentences.chinese: 死了很多游击队人，但是我们看不到他们的尸体。

sentences.english: The guerillas would fight to death before they surrendered.
sentences.chinese: 游击队员宁愿战斗到死，决不投降。

sentences.english: 2299 – In France, guerrilla movement against Islam.
sentences.chinese: 2299年，法国，游击队开始和伊斯兰周旋。

sentences.english: The partisans managed to get away, although the enemy was hot on their tracks.
sentences.chinese: 虽然敌人紧追不舍，游击队员们还是设法跑掉了。

sentences.english: How can the Maoist militia be managed before the constituent assembly elections?
sentences.chinese: 在制宪会议选举前毛派游击队应怎样管理呢？

sentences.english: Kage Da provincial guerrilla activities in Colombia one of the most frequent.
sentences.chinese: 卡格达省是哥伦比亚游击队活动最频繁的地区之一。

definition: Eighth Route Army, the larger of the two major Chinese communist forces fighting the Japanese in the Second Sino-Japanese War (1937-1945)
White Guard or White Movement, anti-communist troops fighting against the Bolsheviks during the Russian Civil War (1917-1922)
New Fourth army of Republic of China, set up in 1937 and controlled by the communists
